First of all I would like to say that I have always been the shy type, and a major introvert. It has always, ALWAYS been hard for me to verbally say things to people,and when I do verbally communicate with others, it's on a one-on-one basis. It's especially hard when it comes to asking people to help me (or do their part in household chores). I have a habit of leaving little notes for people, and writing letters when I have something to say. 

When I write, I can think about what I am going to say....when I verbally say shit, my tounge gets tied and nothing ever comes out right. Which is also why I don't really talk when I'm chilling with people; I'm always afraid that I'm going to say the wrong thing and embarrass myself, and more often than not that is exactly what happens. I am quick to shoot off my mouth when I talk which is why I DON'T TALK!

I still hold a lot of anger within my soul and that comes out in almost everything that I do....and until I find the right way for me to release this anger, it will continue to show in my facial expressions, in my tone of voice, in everything that I do. And if some can't understand that, well I'm sorrie, but I have always been like this...I can't explain it nor is it easy for me to change it. 

Also, any time that I do make some progress, something always happens for me to regress to the state that I was in. Now that I have 10X the stress than I had a year ago at this time, it is even harder for me to find the time to be able to work on my mental problems adequately. Most of my time is spent thinking and going over plan after plan attempting to get my life started. Worrying about bills, rent, finding a trust-worthy roommate before August, acquiring the funds to be able to move again are just a few of the things that are weighing down on my shoulders at the present moment.

Furthermore, I would like to say that I'm sorrie for lacking the ability to verbally communicate with others and only being able to communicate on a one-on-one basis. Even though I shouldn't even really have to say I'm sorrie, people should accept me for who the fuck I am. I've always been an introvert and I can't change that fact, I can only find ways to deal with it and find ways to get my message across and writing is how I deal with it. There's not much I can really do to change that aspect about me and I've accepted that. Don't like it, oh well....that ain't my fault. Sue me for being shy and having to expess myself through writing. 

I have enough of a hard time meeting new people because I lack the ability to verbally communicate with other people. And to those who have known me for a long time and have accepted this fact about me, thank you....and to those who are just getting to know me, have patience with me....and to those who try to push me into verbally communicating things, DON'T! I am slowly working on changing this aspect of mine and any type of pressure to do it quickly regresses me, so please...just give me time and be patient with me. I am doing the best I can with the amount of stress that I have to sort through and it's extremely hard and I don't need any exterior forces trying to make this process go faster. The fact that I write in this so often shows that I am making at least some progress in trying to communicate.

So, if the fact that I need to write to say things buggz anyone...I'm sorrie but fucking deal with it, I have to on a daily basis so give me a break! At least I'm communicating in some way instead of holding EVERYTHING in and not talking to a single person. So what would you rather have, a slow steady-flowing lava flow (in which you can escape) or a huge ass eruption that could follow with devastating consequences. Right now I am a steady-flow of lava; however, if people push me, I'll clam up and explode. It has already happened once and I really don't need it happening again, the first blow up was scary enough. 

In closing, I would like to say that it was quite difficult to make this entry considering it's about a topic I don't like to talk about. I don't the fact that I'm an introvert and I don't like the fact that I'm shy to the point where it cripples my ability to make new friends and communicate to my current friends. I don't like the fact that I can't verbally express myself to other people and that I HAVE to do it through writing. I've written so many poems because of the fact that I can't verbally communicate my feelings to my loved ones. And even though I don't like this fact about me, I have come to deal and accept it as a part of me. Please try to do the same. I'm out! PeAcE!
